quotes: Podesta was the special envoy for climate change in the Biden administration from 2024 to 2025.
He assumed the role in March 2024, when former envoy John Kerry resigned.
In 1972, while in law school at Georgetown University, Podesta acted as campaign manager for Sam Brown, who was running for Colorado state treasurer.
After graduating in 1976, Podesta became a trial attorney for the U.S. Department of Justice in Washington, D.C.
In 1979, Podesta became the subcommittee chief minority counsel for the Senate Judiciary Committee.
He remained with the Senate Judiciary Committee until 1986, when he became chief counsel for the Senate Committee on Agriculture.
In April 1988, Podesta started his own firm with his brother Tony Podesta.
